str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
And, even, also, namely.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A bodily organ, limb, member. Of uncertain affinity; a limb or part of the body.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To defile, spot, stain, soil. From spilos; to stain or soil.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To inflame, fire with passion, set on fire, burn up. From phlox; to cause a blaze, i.e. Ignite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A wheel, course. From trecho; a wheel, i.e. a circuit of physical effects.
Birth, lineage, descent. From the same as genea; nativity; figuratively, nature.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To inflame, fire with passion, set on fire, burn up. From phlox; to cause a blaze, i.e. Ignite.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
Of Hebrew origin; valley of Hinnom; ge-henna, a valley of Jerusalem, used as a name for the place of everlasting punishment.
